mdRecord.dcterms:title: Buck House, interior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Maybeck, Bernard Ralph (American architect and artist, 1862-1957) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: In this men's dormitory, Maybeck was reasonably free to use all the building materials he wanted, but the concrete roof was not used here. The framing of the concrete staircase, however, is remarkable. This two-story dormitory reflects the scale of cottages on a country roadside. Maybeck used local fieldstone from Alton and Grafton. The roof tiles evidence Maybeck's first experiments with coloristic effects, repeated in varied patterns on the roofs of other residence halls. The College recently replaced at great expense the Buck House tile roof, using tile similar to the material found on the original roof. http://www.principia.edu/maybeck/build/buck.htm [work]
